parameters.description: Case insensitive substring match within name, description. Search terms may be separated by spaces, results are returned that match ALL if the search terms of the operand is set to AND, or ANY of the search terms if the operand is set to OR

id.description: The unique identifier for this specific monitoring subscription

A unique identifier (UUID) for this entity
A unique identifier (UUID) for this entity

action.description: Code to be used by URL handler to determine action

Device.description: A device in xMatters is any means of receiving a notification message. Devices can include physical items like phones, or intangible items such as email accounts

defaultDevice.description: True if this device can receive notifications when the user has no active devices

delay.description: The number of minutes to wait for a response before contacting the next device

name.description: The name of the device. Example: Work Email, Home Phone

priorityThreshold.description: The minimum priority of an event for it to be delivered to this device

sequence.description: The order in which the device will be contacted, where 0 represents the first device contacted

testStatus.description: Whether the device has been tested

DeviceInput.description: A device in xMatters is any means of receiving a notification message. Devices can include physical items like phones, or intangible items such as email accounts

defaultDevice.description: True if this device can receive notifications when the user has no active devices. a.k.a. Fail-safe device

delay.description: The number of minutes to wait for a response before contacting the next device

name.description: The name of the device. Example: Work Email, Home Phone

priorityThreshold.description: The minimum priority of an event for it to be delivered to this device

sequence.description: The order in which the device will be contacted, where 0 represents the first device contacted

testStatus.description: Whether the device has been tested

timeframes.description: Timeframes when this device is active

id.description: The identifier of the resource

targetName.description: The target name of the resource

id.description: The identifier of the resource

targetName.description: The target name of the resource

DeviceTimeframe.description: The timeframe in which a device is available to receive notifications

days.description: List of the days of the week this timeframe is active

durationInMinutes.description: The length of the timeframe in minutes

excludeHolidays.description: True if the timeframe is not active on holidays

name.description: Name of the Timeframe. Example: "After hours"

startTime.description: The time of day that the timeframe begins, in the device owners timezone

timezone.description: The time zone of the device owner. Example:  US/Pacific

startTime.description: The time of day that the timeframe begins, in the device owners timezone

eventId.description: A legacy identifier (numeric) that represents this resource

properties.description: Map of property names and values

revision.description: Integer that increases to indicate revision of this entity, unlikely to be sequential as it is generated from a table specific sequence

properties.description: Map of property names and values

recipients.description: Note: required if pre-configured recipients do not exist

responseOptions.description: A list of the response options to be displayed for the event. Response options are identified by a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID)

Group.description: Groups are used for collecting users and devices and organizing them into notification schedules

GroupInput.description: Groups are used for collecting users and devices and organizing them into notification schedules

allowDuplicates.description: Whether the group allows a notification to be sent to a device multiple times

observedByAll.description: Whether the group notifications are observed by all

useDefaultDevices.description: Whether the default user device should be used when sending out a notification to the group

supervisors.description: A list of group supervisors. Groups must have at least one supervisor

targetName.description: The target name of the resource

text.description: The log line text (should be formatted appropriately to key=value pairs by the caller)

count.description: Count of notifications before suppression is activated

minutes.description: Rolling time window in minutes within which only count notifications will pass through the filter

Person.description: Someone in the xMatters system who can receive notifications is called a 'Person'. Every person in the xMatters system is a user defined by a set of details, including ID number, user name, login password, and so on

firstName.description: The first name of the user

language.description: The preferred language of the user: Example: en

lastName.description: The last name of the user

phoneLogin.description: A numeric string that identifies users when they phone in to xMatters. This string may contain only digits and must be unique within the company

timezone.description: The time zone of the user. Example:  US/Pacific

webLogin.description: The ID of the user when they log on to the web user interface. This value must be unique within the company and is often identical to the targetName field

PersonInput.description: Someone in the xMatters system who can receive notifications is called a 'Person'. Every person in the xMatters system is a user defined by a set of details, including ID number, user name, login password, and so on

firstName.description: The first name of the user

language.description: The preferred language of the user: Example: en

lastName.description: The last name of the user

phoneLogin.description: A numeric string that identifies users when they phone in to xMatters. This string may contain only digits and must be unique within the company

roles.description: A list of the user's roles. Users must have at least one role

supervisors.description: A list of supervisors of this users. If this value is not provided, the XXX user becomes the supervisor. To assign a user as a supervisor, the authenticating user must have the appropriate permissions

timezone.description: The time zone of the user. Example:  US/Pacific

webLogin.description: The ID of the user when they log on to the web user interface. This value must be unique within the company and is often identical to the targetName field

key.description: API key used to identify a person

targetName.description: An identifier such as a name that can be used to identify a resource

status.description: Whether the recipient is active. Inactive recipients do not receive notifications

externalKey.description: Identifies this resource in an external system. Used when externallyOwned is true

externallyOwned.description: True if this resource is managed by an external system. Externally-owned resources cannot be deleted in the xMatters user interface

targeted.description: Indicates if this is a targeted recipient. If omitted assume false

locked.description: Lists the fields of externally-owned objects that are locked and cannot be modified in the xMatters user interface

responseCount.description: Number of responses required before xMatters stops notifying targeted group or dynamic team

400.description: Bad Request - The request is malformed

401.description: Unauthorized - The caller cannot be identified

403.description: Forbidden - The authenticated user does not have permission to perform this action

404.description: Not Found - The requested resource does not exist

409.description: Conflict - The action cannot be performed in the system
